properties.headline: Continued: Dam Overflow Alert continued by Manitoba Infrastructure in the areas of Riverdale Municipality and RM of Whitehead
properties.description: Continued: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure is advising that risk of dam failure at the RIVERS RESERVOIR DAM continues at lower risk. Inspection results and lower water levels and flow have lowered the risk of imminent failure and evacuation orders for the inundation area can be lifted. Failure of the dam would result in extreme flooding and dangerous situations. Residents in the inundation zones should remain ready to evacuate on short notice if conditions change. Avoid water bodies, valleys, low lying areas and affected areas. Move to higher ground if required and avoid flooded areas. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca.
properties.instruction:
Avoid water bodies, valleys, low lying areas and affected areas. 
Move to higher ground if required and avoid flooded areas. 
Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. 
Use caution when driving on all roads as road conditions may have changed. 
Follow all directions by local authorities and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. 
Stay tuned to local media for updates

properties.headline: Police Officer Stabbed in Bridgewater, Nova Scotia, Suspect at Large
properties.description: Man at large after stabbing a Bridgewater Police officer in Bridgewater, Nova Scotia. The weapon has not been recovered. He was last seen in wooded areas and back yards near the south edge of town approximately 4 hours ago. Police and RCMP have been actively searching for the suspect. He is wearing shorts with no shoes or shirt. If you see any suspicious persons or activity call the police.
properties.instruction: If you see any suspicious persons or activity call the police.

properties.headline: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert is being issued by Village of Richmound
properties.description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Richmound. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Village of Richmound water system.  This advisory is in effect until further notice.
properties.instruction: Boil water for at least 1 minute prior to use.  This includes for drinking purposes, washing of fruits and vegetables and brushing teeth. Do not drink from any public drinking fountains supplied with water from the public water supply. Use an alternative water source known to be safe.  Listen for updates on the situation.

properties.headline: Update to Civil Emergency Alert Issued by Government of Saskatchewan
properties.description:
Update for the Civil Emergency Alert issued by the Government of Saskatchewan. The state of emergency in Saskatchewan remains in effect. 
UPDATE: for the week of July 20:  the public is being reminded, as additional businesses, services and activities re-open during Phase 4.2, to always practice physical distancing of 2 metres when engaging with others.
The Northwest Region remains restricted as Re-Open Saskatchewan proceeds.  Go to the Saskatchewan COVID website listed in the instructions for a complete list of allowable services and activities in the Northwest Region.
During all Phases of Re-Open Saskatchewan all public health orders, are to be followed and applied in all public and private gatherings.
properties.instruction: Wash your hands often and if you are sick or symptomatic for COVID 19, stay home. For details on Phase 4.2 and all Phases of Re-Open Saskatchewan and the most recent updates on the provincial response to COVID 19 go to:  Saskatchewan.ca/COVID19

properties.headline: High Water Level Emergency Advisory Alert issued by the Water Security Agency.
properties.description: The Saskatchewan Water Security Agency is advising that water levels are extremely high in many water systems in the far north. Logs, debris, unstable banks and other obstacles that may not normally be encountered are creating safety hazards for water travel. These high water levels are being closely monitored and residents should avoid the water and be exercising extreme caution when accessing water systems if travel is necessary.
properties.instruction: Residents living in close proximity to the affected water systems should follow directions of local authorities, comply with restrictions and take all necessary precautions.

properties.headline: Update: Flood Warning Continued for the Churchill River from the Saskatchewan-Manitoba Border to Leaf Rapids Manitoba
properties.description:
Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructureâ€™s Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Warning for the Churchill River from the Saskatchewan-Manitoba Border to Leaf Rapids Manitoba.

If you are in the affected area, be watchful as local waterways are expected to rise quickly and may cause flooding. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Use caution when driving on all roads as road conditions may have changed. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by local authorities and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Stay tuned to local media for updates. Up to date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca

properties.headline: rainfall warning in effect
properties.description:
30 to 50 mm of rain is expected by Wednesday morning.

A strong low pressure system over Quebec will continue to spread rain across southern Baffin Island today. Storm total rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 mm are expected in Iqaluit and Kimmirut.

The rain will taper off on Wednesday.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
properties.instruction: Watch for possible washouts near rivers, creeks and culverts.

properties.headline: heat warning in effect
properties.description:
Very high temperatures and humidity are expected for much of Nova Scotia.

Time span: continuing until Wednesday over parts of mainland Nova Scotia.

Maximum daytime temperatures: 27 to 30 degrees Celsius, except cooler along parts of the coast.

Minimum nighttime temperatures: 14 to 16 degrees Celsius.

Locations: mainland Nova Scotia and eastern Cape Breton.

Remarks: Temperatures will drop below heat warning criteria tonight for eastern Cape Breton and northern and eastern mainland Nova Scotia.

###

Extreme heat affects everyone.

Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion.

Information is provided on the Nova Scotia Department of Health and Wellness website at https://novascotia.ca/heat-related-illness/.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
properties.instruction:
Drink plenty of water even before you feel thirsty and stay in a cool place.

Never leave people or pets inside a parked vehicle.

properties.headline: heat warning in effect
properties.description:
An extended period of very warm weather will continue.

Time span: continuing through Wednesday.

Maximum daytime temperatures: up to 29 degrees Celsius, except cooler along parts of the coast.

Minimum overnight temperatures: 16 degrees Celsius.

Locations: central and northeastern Newfoundland.

Remarks: Very high temperatures will dominate over most of central and northeastern Newfoundland for the next couple of days.

The heat warning thresholds may be reached for some locations through Thursday.

###

Extreme heat affects everyone.

Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion.

Please call HealthLine 811 for advice on health risks, symptoms and precautions associated with heat.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
properties.instruction: Reduce your heat risk.  Schedule outdoor activities during the coolest parts of the day.

properties.headline: heat warning in effect
properties.description:
High temperatures and humidity are expected for much of southern New Brunswick.

Time span: today.

Maximum daytime temperatures: near 29 degrees Celsius, except cooler along parts of the coast.

Locations: southern New Brunswick.

Remarks: Humidex values may reach 35 in some areas of southern New Brunswick today. Drier air is now moving southward across the province and this warning is expected to be ended later today.

###

Extreme heat affects everyone.

Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
properties.instruction:
Drink plenty of water even before you feel thirsty and stay in a cool place.

Never leave people or pets inside a parked vehicle.
